trend_summary: Over the four dates the small market town spreads gradually outward, replacing several peripheral fields with housing estates and light-industrial roofs. A new bypass appears on the east, while road infilling tightens the street mesh. Agricultural parcels consolidate and become more uniformly cultivated, yet riparian tree bands and scattered woodland patches expand slightly.
notable_changes: Progressive residential growth north-east and south-west of the historic core, consuming former cropland.
New curving arterial/bypass road built along the eastern perimeter, linking to existing highways.
Appearance of light-industrial/commercial buildings with large roofs on the northern fringe.
Field boundaries reorganised into larger rectangular blocks, signalling farm consolidation.
Incremental increase in hedgerows and riparian woodland, enhancing green connectivity.
